--- title: "ğŸ—“ï¸ Session 3: Basic object types in R" date: "2024-03-28" date-modified: last-modified --- This session is video-based since it introduces some very important fundamentals, which might be a bit boring to listen to in a lecture. In the videos, you learn about the most important and most fundamental object types in R, such as decimal numbers or words. While this might look a bit boring at first, understanding these basic types is fundamental for all the more advanced (and exiting) stuff in the future! ## ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ« Lecture Slides Either click on the slide area below or click [here](/2024Spring/material/slides/T3-Objects.pdf) to download the slides. ```{=html}

``` ::: ## ğŸ“š Mandatory Reading Read the following tutorials: - [Fundamental object types in R I: Functions](/2024Spring/tutorials/obj-types-i-functions/index.qmd) - [Fundamental object types in R II: Vectors](/2024Spring/tutorials/obj-types-ii-vectors/index.qmd) ### ğŸ† Further readings *I suggest you read these references after you learned about data frames in* *session 4 and data wrangling techniques in sessions 8 and 9.* - Sections 1-3 in [Chapter 12](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/logicals) of @r4ds. - [Chapter 13](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/numbers) in @r4ds. - [Chapter 14](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/strings) in @r4ds. ## âœï¸ Coursework - Do the `ObjectTypes1` exercises of the package `DataScienceExercises` ::: {.callout-tip collapse="true"} ## Quick code for starting the exercises ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} learnr::run_tutorial( name = "ObjectTypes1", package = "DataScienceExercises", shiny_args=list("launch.browser"=TRUE)) ``` ::: ::: - If you have questions or problems, please post them in the Moodle forum
